properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 4 at 8:16PM EST until January 8 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...White River...

.Minor lowland flooding will continue in a few locations along the
lower White River and at one location along the East Fork White
River. Flooding will continue into the weekend and perhaps into next
week at a couple of these locations.

Rainfall earlier this week caused rises along portions of main stem
rivers in southern Indiana, although most locations have remained
within a couple of feet of flood stage.

Lowland flooding will mainly impact local river roads, parks, and
agricultural land, although one river cabin community may be
impacted briefly near Hazleton.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Hazleton.
* until Wednesday afternoon.
* There have been no observations in the last 24 hours.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It is forecast to crest at 18.1 feet Sunday afternoon
and will fall below flood stage by late Tuesday night.
* At 18.0 feet...Floodwaters cover much low ground in agricultural
season.  Low lying oil fields...Pottsville Road and possibly a few
other low rural roads flood.  High water isolates Pottstown, a
river cabin community.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
